1.title: Episode #1.1

episode of.title: Hidden Histories: Britain's Oldest Family Businesses (TV Mini-Series 2014– )

1.plot: Richard Balson's family have been butchers for almost 500 years, since Henry VIII was on the throne. He goes back through centuries of butchery to the origin of the British high street. Along the way he discovers how the Balsons have stayed in the butchery business despite scandal and tragedy.

2.title: Toye the Medal Maker

episode of.title: Hidden Histories: Britain's Oldest Family Businesses (TV Mini-Series 2014– )

2.plot: Fiona Toye married into a family that has been making regalia for generations, including OBEs for the royal family. The film follows Fiona as she steers this traditional company through the 21st century.

3.title: Durtnell the Builder

episode of.title: Hidden Histories: Britain's Oldest Family Businesses (TV Mini-Series 2014– )

3.plot: Alex Durtnell's family have been builders for over 400 years. We follow Alex as he travels back through the centuries and rediscovers the houses his family have built, right back to the reign of Elizabeth I.

imdb.title: Hidden Histories: Britain's Oldest Family Businesses
akas: Hidden Histories: Britain's Oldest Family Businesses (United Kingdom)
plot: Three-part series which reveals the extraordinary history of three of Britain's longest-running family businesses.
